item.title: Arrest after Billy Sharp hurt at end of play-off match
item.description: Sheffield United's captain was knocked to the ground and was reported to be "shook up and bleeding".

item.title: Children 'food poisoned after fridges are turned off'
item.description: Parents are turning off appliances at night to save power and money, a Cornwall food bank claims.

item.title: Ukraine war: Medic's shock over Russian tank hospital hit
item.description: Medic David Anderson said the tank still had its gun pointing directly at a Ukrainian hospital.

item.title: Skelmersdale: Five hurt in suspected explosion at flat
item.description: Three people are taken to hospital following the blast at a home in Lancashire.

item.title: Dan Walker's old BBC Breakfast job up for grabs with great salary
item.description: Have you got what it takes to join Sally Nugent, Naga Munchetty and Charlie Stayt?

item.title: Picasso portrait of his lover Marie-Thérèse Walter as a sea creature fetches $67.5 million
item.description: Pablo Picasso's painting of his lover Marie-Thérèse Walter, in which she appears as a tentacled sea creature, surpassed its estimate when it came up for auction for the first time ever on Tuesday.

item.title: Ukrainian Holdouts in Mariupol Surrender to an Uncertain Fate
item.description: The government’s order for hundreds of remaining fighters to stand down offers Russia a propaganda victory, but prospects for a prisoner swap seem unclear at best.

item.title: Louise Minchin makes cryptic post on BBC return as Dan Walker exits
item.description: Former BBC Breakfast host Louise Minchin made a return to the show on Tuesday as co-host Dan Walker said his goodbyes

item.title: Japan's Economy Shrinks Slightly in First Quarter
Pennsylvania primaries test future direction of the Republican Party
Pennsylvania voters go to polls amid tight 3-way GOP U.S. Senate race
Climate change swells odds of record India, Pakistan heatwaves
item.description: A UK study says record-breaking temperatures in NW India and Pakistan are now 100 times more likely.

item.title: Runner loses wedding ring during a 100k Jurassic Coast race
item.description: Jonathan Haynes believes the wedding ring slipped off his finger during a fall at West Bay cliffs.

item.title: U.S. Gun Production Triples Since 2000, Fueled by Handgun Purchases
item.description: The A.T.F. released a trove of gun manufacturing data on Tuesday, the first comprehensive survey of firearms commerce data in decades.

item.title: Before the Buffalo Shooting Began, Suspect Invited Others to Review Plans on Discord.
item.description: The man accused of killing 10 people at a Buffalo supermarket permitted a small group to join his private chatroom about 30 minutes before the massacre.

item.title: Japan’s Economy Shrank 1 Percent as Consumers Fled Covid
item.description: The world’s third-largest economy lost momentum in the first three months of the year after the Omicron variant suppressed demand at home.

item.title: Tory MP arrested on suspicion of rape
item.description: Tory MP arrested on suspicion of sexual offences, including rape and sexual assault, over seven-year period.

item.title: Michigan Judge Suspends an Abortion Ban From 1931
item.description: The law is obsolete because of Roe v. Wade but still on the books. Abortion rights advocates are worried that a potential Supreme Court ruling overturning Roe will revive it.

item.title: Why Do We Swallow What Big Oil and the Green Movement Tell Us?
item.description: Neither is being realistic about a smooth transition to renewable energy.

item.title: The Right Weaponizes America Against Itself
item.description: You cannot defend the ideal of E pluribus unum by deleting pluribus.
